DOC.brief_summary: To investigate whether interactive family base lifestyle programme lead behaviour change 6 month primary outcome increase level moderate vigorous physical activity ( MVPA ) .
DOC.brief_title: PRE-STARt Intervention - Trial Interactive Family Based Lifestyle Programme
DOC.detailed_description: To investigate whether lifestyle programme result change follow outcomes 3 6 month baseline assessment ( Child ) - An increase objectively measure total amount physical activity - An increase proportion meet MVPA guideline ( measure objectively ) - Reduction time spend sedentary ( measure objectively self-reported ) - Change self-reported physical activity - Reduction measure adiposity ( body mass index percentile , per cent body fat ) - Improvement psychological factor may mediate physical activity participation ( self-efficacy , motivation , attitude , social support enjoyment physical activity ; physical self-perceptions ) - Change healthy food provision parenting practice healthy food - Improvement diet composition . - Improvement knowledge physical activity nutrition . - Improvement cardio-metabolic variable ( blood pressure , glucose , HbA1c , cholesterol ) The Investigators also include qualitative data collect : - Evaluation form follow intervention workshop session complete Parent/guardian , child facilitator - Feedback focus group hold follow completion total intervention i.e . 8 session To investigate whether lifestyle programme result change follow outcomes 3 6 month baseline assessment ( Parent ( ) /guardian ( ) ) - An increase objectively measure total volume physical activity - An increase proportion meet MVPA guideline ( measure objectively ) - Reduction time spend sedentary ( measure objectively self-reported ) - Change self-reported physical activity - Reduction measure adiposity ( body mass index percentile , per cent body fat ) - Change healthy food provision parenting practice healthy food - Improvement diet composition . - Improvement knowledge physical activity nutrition .
DOC.criteria: Parents/guardians answer question eligibility questionnaire child family health history . Participants invite participate 1214 year old inclusive ( 12 year 0 day 14 year 354 day old ) identify follow risk factor development Type 2 Diabetes ( identify eligibility questionnaire ) : BMI > 95th percentile age gender OR BMI > 85th percentile PLUS one follow list : Family history Diabetes ( first degree relative ) . Nonwhite ethnicity . Watching TV/play computer game 2 hour day ( selfreport ) . Sugar intake 1.5 can ( 532 ml ) fizzy pop/fruit juice per day ( selfreport ) . Young people eligible participation study outside age range interest ( < 11 year 364 day > 14 year 1 day ) , exist diagnosis Type 1 Type 2 Diabetes , < 85th percentile . Young people also exclude provide write assent parent/guardian provide write consent .
